sub_title: Marketing & Business Development: Inspire - Innovate - Collaborate
summary:
Natural leader helping teams to grow and achieve better collaboration and higher work satisfaction.

Determined and result driven Marketing, Sales and Innovation Leader. More than 20 years of proven track record for growing sales, profitability and market share. As a driver of change I regard challenges as opportunities. I get energy from developing effective strategies which add value to the customer. As a leader I focus on stimulating collaboration and removing internal barriers to create impact. My team members consider me as inspiring leader and coach with a passion for people, brands and innovation. My solid experience gained in multinationals and mid-sized companies, and in different industries - from technical B2B to healthcare and fast moving consumer goods - allows me to quickly add value and find new opportunities.

Expertise & competencies: 
- Strategy development and deployment corporate, marketing and sales
- Inspiring and result oriented leadership and change management 
- Structured and analytical approach to challenges 
- Innovation in products and services
- Excellent negotiation and presentation skills 

Saville professional styles core strengths: communicating information, creating innovation, providing leadership, showing resilience  
Belbin team roles: Chairman & Shaper 
Margerison-McCann team management profile: Creator-Innovator with related roles Explorer-Promoter and Thruster-Organizer 

dieter.marquardt@gmx.net 
+31-(0)6-463 21 451

school.name: WU (Vienna University of Economics and Business)

profile_positions.description:
Professionalize Orga's marketing, strategic business development and lead generation activities as part of the Orga management team. Orga BV is the trusted partner of choice when it comes to the protection of people, assets and the environment. Since 1972, Orga has been delivering high quality and efficient solutions for marking assets and landing areas to ensure safe operations.
 
Orga develops and manufactures smart offshore and onshore obstruction marking, CAP 437 helideck lighting, aids to navigation and remote power supply systems. The company has a deep understanding of local and international regulatory code requirements and is conscientious and committed to delivering customers’ goals and exceeding expectations. Orga operates worldwide with offices in Europe, Asia and the Middle East.
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Ampelmann is a highly innovative business providing safe and efficient motion compensationg gangway solutions for the off-shore industry (windparks, oil and gas exploration). Key achievements as Marketing Director ad interim:

-	Set up and manage the Marketing department with clear objectives, roles and responsibilities and KPI’s
-	Developed a differentiated brand positioning and identity for Ampelmann
-	Launched a new website and integrated communications approach: www.ampelmann.nl
-	Developed a new product development process ensuring customer and market input in the innovation process
-	Professionaled the go-to-market approach
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director a.i.

profile_positions.description:
•	Grew sales, market share and profitability of Van Wijhe Verf’s decorative coatings business targeted at professional painters (B2B) and consumers (B2C) during the economic crisis
•	Initiated the focus on big DIY superstores like Gamma, Karwei, Praxis, etc. Achieved listings and market share growth through innovative products like sustainable wall-paints
•	Defended the strong position in smaller stores through the "Wijzonol Vakverf Servicepunt" soft-franchise concept
•	Re-organized and professionalized Van Wijhe's sales and marketing departments resulting in aligned plans and commitment in activation
•	Simplified distribution by optimizing the value-chain
•	Negotiated successfully in "channel conflict" situations
•	Established Van Wijhe Verf as innovation leader through numerous products and services like the "Wijzonol Overstapservice", "Wijzonol Experience" relationship events, the fastest drying linseed oil paint brand: "OER" etc.
•	Played a key role in defining the corporate strategy. Developed a sustainability strategy that led  to the establishment of a "Green Team" and corporate goals over-achieving industry standards
profile_positions.title: Marketing and Sales Director (Commercieel Directeur)

profile_positions.description:
•	Grew market share and brand awareness whilst at the same time reducing marketing spend in Euro's and as percentage of turnover
•	Turned around Van Wijhe Verf's marketing approach from "push to pull" leading to increased direct contacts with end-users and significantly higher purchase intent
•	Professionalized the marketing department by establishing a customer-oriented and focused segment structure
•	Initiated and managed a change management program based on Net Promoter Score (NPS) increasing motivation and effectiveness of the marketing and sales organization
•	Established clear and simplified internal processes for better alignment with sales, R&D and production
•	Enhanced the Wijzonol, Ralston (Export) and Marlise brands through unique positionings and appearances. This led to increased brand awareness and competitive differentiation 
•	Realized cost benefits through international synergies, e.g. for websites, visuals and packaging design
•	Created insights through a structured market intelligence program
profile_positions.title: Head of Marketing

profile_positions.description:
•	Changed the image of Philips from "shavers, TV's and light bulbs" to a "health & well-being" company through a B2B thought-leadership campaign. This campaign won the prestigious M&M award for best global brand campaign
•	Managed and controlled partnerships with five major media owners (CNN, CNBC, FT, Economist, Harvard Business Review) to generate content and leverage communication opportunities
•	Directed and executed decision rights over the entire creative development process from brief to activation ensuring relevant and distinctive executions

Member of Philips' Top Potential program.
profile_positions.title: Director Brand Marketing Communications

profile_positions.description:
•	Transformed the communication strategy of Philips Lighting from an undifferentiated to a focused and segmented approach through...
•	Creative platforms and communication channel strategies for three themes: energy efficiency, scene setting and health & well-being
•	Global campaigns that established Philips as leader in sustainable lighting solutions by linking the brand to events and Al Gore's film on global warming
•	Ensuring correct execution of the strategy in local markets and sharing of best practices

Member of Philips' Top Potential program.
profile_positions.title: Global Marketing Communications Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed a global marketing strategy for Decorative Coatings that gave direction in geography, M&A candidates, pricing, brand portfolio streamlining, etc.
•	Increased local marketing professionalism and supported M&A activities, for example by playing a key role in a major acquisition in the Czech Republic
•	Revised and managed the innovation process from idea generation to overseeing the development and market introduction
•	Created a customer segmentation for AkzoNobel's three professional paints and managed implementation in local markets
•	Played a key role in the integration of BU’s Decorative Coatings Europe and International leading to an effective structure and cost benefits

As member of the AkzoNobel "Octagon" high-potential program co-authored “Value Creation through R&D and Innovation” and implemented it in the BU
profile_positions.title: Global Marketing Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed a portfolio of 50+ DIY paint brands and created the first ever common brand strategy. This led to a major reduction of the number of brands and harmonization of their appearance. Whilst some strong local names were kept, other elements like packaging, visuals, TV commercials, etc. were harmonized leading to major cost benefits. 
•	Introduced a number of new product and packaging initiatives like a pink ceiling paint that turns white or a packaging lid for wall-paints that can be used for the paint roller
•	Optimized international co-operation by leading a strong European Marketing Team that initiated many marketing innovations like "Color Bars", "Powerwalls" on high-traffic buildings, etc.
•	Professionalized planning with a ‘3 Year Strategic Marketing Plan’ process

Successful completion of Akzo Nobel's Leadership Training on management and leadership skills
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director Europe Retail

profile_positions.description:
•	Proud to have developed and built the world's largest diabetes care brand, Accu-Chek, out of more than 40 different local brands with an annual turnover of more than 2 billion USD. This included…
•	Convincing all local markets of the benefits of a global brand
•	Enforcing a new central brand management structure and professionalizing the organization on all levels, e.g. even top management followed a brand management training at Interbrand
•	Changing the approach-to-market from B2B to B2C by putting the patient in control 

•	Member of Roche's high-potential program
•	Won 1st prize in a New Venture contest with a business plan to provide health-checks on location reducing costs for corporations and insurers. This venture was implemented as pilot in the US
•	Co-authored a new strategy for the Board of the Roche Diagnostics Division
•	Successfully completed a leadership development program at the London Business School
profile_positions.title: Strategic Marketing Director Patient Monitoring

profile_positions.description:
•	Built and led a new global marketing department
•	Enforced brand consistency with the local SPAR organizations consisting of more than 18,000 supermarkets in 28 countries
•	Increased turnover per square meter through new shop formats for SPAR, EUROSPAR and SPAR Express. E.g. developed and oversaw implementation of EUROSPAR store design guidelines in Switzerland, Norway, Sweden, Belgium, Poland and Greece. 
•	Created a premium brand positioning for the private label range
•	Amongst others, introduced the world's most international private label product, SPAR American Cola, in 18 countries with the same TV ad, pricing structure, packaging design, etc.
•	Increased brand awareness through a European athletics sponsorship program

Participated in ECR Europe/Category Management projects
profile_positions.title: Marketing Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Increased the share of the ca. 450 SPAR private label products from 10% to 17% by...
•	Building and leading a product management department that managed all marketing activities instead of the buying organization 
•	Creating a new premium positioning that made consumers proud using private label products
•	Developing TV ads and other brand expressions previously unknown for private label products
•	Identifying and introducing many new products, a. o. 
•	SPAR American Cola, the first private label cola in Austria, which achieved a higher market share than Pepsi
•	SPAR Natur*Pur, the first national organic product range
•	Managed the market intelligence program with Nielsen and GfK
profile_positions.title: Product Manager Spar Own Brands
